results.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
results.description:
About Us

Here at Elevate Security, we're building the world's first-ever proactive insider risk platform focused on enabling enterprises to shift left of loss by identifying the users most likely to cause a breach and orchestrating additional security to minimize the likelihood of an incident.
We're looking for exceptional and passionate people to help us build this future and redefine the burgeoning security landscape.

We're looking for exceptional and passionate people to help us build this future and redefine the security landscape. There are few times when life shows up with a golden ticket. This is one of those times! We are looking for incredible people to join us on our journey. Come join one of the top 10 best tech startups in Berkeley (from anywhere in the world; we're remote)!

What you'll work on
  • You will evolve our product to a point where Security Engineers and CISOs across the Fortune 1000 will embed our product into their critical workflows.
  • You'll implement flexible frontend and backend microservices to enable end users to search, visualize and draw insights from millions of security events streaming in near real-time
  • You will build start of the art applications to empower end users to minimize security risk by providing security workflow automation tooling based on security event streams and employee context
  • You will work together with the team to achieve a good balance of cost, reliability, and ability to move fast to serve our users.
  • You will participate in the entire lifecycle, from idea inception all the way through implementation, rollout and evolution over time. 
  • You'll help us scale our application infrastructure as we go through hypergrowth
Our Tech Stack

Frontend:

  • React/Redux
  • TypeScript
  • Storybook
  • CSS3
  • ES6

Backend:

  • Python / Django / Flask
  • Postgres / Redis / MySQL / ElasticSearch
  • Kubernetes / Docker / EKS
  • AWS / S3 / EC2 / Cloudfront / RDS
Experience
  • 5+ years of experience building and scaling microservices with react (and/or other javascript) and python web servers
  • Strong customer empathy and desire to work closely with Product, Sales, and Customer Success to build a great product that users love.
  • Breadth of experience building customer-centric products using development best practices.
  • Mastery of at least one programming language. We use Javascript & Python
  • Growth mindset to learn whatever you don't know! 
  • Strong compatibility with our company values.

 

What makes Elevate Security a great place to work?
  • We care about your career. At Elevate Security we encourage each other to constantly grow and expand our skills and knowledge. Mentorship is part of our culture as you work side by side with some of the brightest talent.
  • At such a small, tight-knit startup, you matter tremendously and your contributions make an immediate impact.
  • We have fun! No matter how fast we grow or how busy we are, we always remember to laugh and enjoy each other and our clients.
  • Balancing our careers and personal lives is important to us. We want you to work where and when you work best.
  • Embracing our culture of diversity, constant learning, and collaboration makes us a better team and helps us build a better product.
  • We are mission driven. We never lose sight of why we do what we do.
  • We're genuinely nice, optimistic, inclusive, and empathetic people. We won't hire jerks.
  • We're remote!
Benefits
  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Flexible Time Off Policy
  • Paid parental leave
  • 401k
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid time off for volunteering
  • Professional development funds

results.title: Full-Stack Developer (Mid-Level)
results.description:
Description

We're always keeping our eyes out for great people—always looking, carefully hiring. The right person loves collaboration with coworkers and clients and believes it leads to the best work. The right builder also wants to work in a learning-hungry web environment and help lead the web industry by sharing. Sparkbox has been intentionally working to build a team where we acknowledge our own imperfections, make all feel welcome, and humbly help each other grow.

If you're right for this position, you have solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (and applicable browser support) while being mindful of the diverse ecosystem of devices and connections. You've gained enough industry experience to have proven success shipping quality web products while collaborating with teams. You care about and are eager to learn the details of deployment, commit history, refactoring, design patterns, web accessibility and other development practices. You understand the value of design systems throughout the product design and development lifecycle and are willing to dig deep on this topic. You have a standards-centric view of the web, know its limitations and possibilities, and care about performance and progressive enhancement.

You will be expected to help craft solutions to client needs, recognizing the constraints of each unique situation. You'll work with our team of designers and developers to turn those solutions into high-quality, well-tested websites and applications that are accessible to as many people as possible.

We're looking for applicants with professional web development experience. To be very clear: if you don't have experience working as a web developer beyond a classroom or a bootcamp, this particular position is not a good match. Instead, you may be a great fit for our Full-Stack Developer Apprenticeship.

Requirements

We're actively looking for individuals that will bring a diverse perspective to the Sparkbox office. Passion and humility are vital, as you'll work directly with our designers, project managers, and other developers at Sparkbox. You'll also interact with clients and should feel comfortable presenting work. You'll need to be hungry to learn new things, advance your skills, and push to find new processes.

A few things you could spend your days with:

  • JavaScript, Typescript, and frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue, and Express
  • CSS, Sass, and CSS-in-JS built responsively for many browsers
  • Clean, semantic HTML
  • Git, Github, CircleCI, Netlify, and Heroku
  • Dynamic Pattern Libraries, Design Systems, Storybook
  • Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA or higher) and Progressive Enhancement
  • WordPress, Drupal, ExpressionEngine and other CMS technologies
  • Closely working with UI Designers to translate designs to code
  • Test-Driven Development
  • Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Potential to lead project teams in partnership with client developers
  • Weekly time dedicated to mentoring more junior team members and apprentices
  • Share your learnings on the Sparkbox blog— Check out The Foundry
Inclusive Mindset

Sparkbox has been intentionally working to build a team where we acknowledge our own imperfections, make all feel welcome, and humbly help each other grow. If you can bring a fresh perspective to a team of humble people who love what they do, we'd love to talk with you.

Benefits & Compensation

Our compensation amount for this role is targeted at $70,000 - $95,000 for all remote locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate skillset and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed in this posting.

In return for your outstanding work, Sparkbox offers the following:

  • Remote work
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Healthcare Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Group Life Insurance
  • Mental Health Benefit (Employer Paid)
  • Accident, Critical Illness & Hospital Insurance
  • Health Savings Account (Employer Match)
  • Flex Savings Account
  • Simple IRA (Employer Match)
  • Paid Vacation
  • Vacation-Buy Option
  • Annual Vacation Bonus
  • Annual Wellness Budget
  • Annual Education Budget and Match
  • Home-Office Budget
  • Competitive Salary
  • Commission Opportunities
  • Paid Holidays
  • Short/Long-Term Disability
  • Provided Equipment
  • Some of the Best Coworkers You'll Ever Meet

People and families come first around here, which is part of why we offer 13 paid holidays (including a week or more shutdown at the end of the year) in addition to vacation.

All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. to be considered. Sparkbox is not registered internationally or in CA, NY, or IL at this time. 

PLEASE NOTE: Be sure to watch your spam folder after you apply, as some emails from our applicant tracking system find their way to the wrong folder. We never ghost our applicants, so if you haven't heard from us, chances are the email is hiding in your Spam or Promotions folder.

_____________

It is the policy of Sparkbox to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Sparkbox prohibits any such discrimination or harassment.

results.title: Operations Manager
results.description:
JOB TITLE: Operations Manager

DIVISION: Nuclear

LOCATION OF WORK: 

Remote – based in one of the following states:

  • Colorado
  • Florida
  • Idaho
  • Minnesota
  • New Jersey
  • New Mexico
  • North Carolina
  • Ohio
  • Oregon
  • Tennessee
  • Utah
  • Virginia
  • Washington D.C.
  • Washington

TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS: Must be willing to relocate to the to-be-determined U.S. MMR facility location.

DESCRIPTION:

The Operations Manager reports to the Manager, Reactor Manufacturing. The Operations Manager responsibilities include:

  • Develop Manufacturing Management Frameworks & Systems for Manufacturing Team; MRP, Maintenance, Lean, CI, HPI,DFA, DFM, Change Control, etc.
  • MRP System Implementation, Financial Planning (CAPEX, OPEX), production scheduling, work cell planning, procurement, etc.
  • Workforce planning & development Skill Set Identification, training program development, integration with local educational institutions
  • Factory & Manufacturing Systems testing and acceptance programs
  • Prototype assembly processes and systems
  • Develop and implement Manufacturing assurance, oversight of manufacturing governance programs


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

The main responsibilities and authorities for the Operations Manager are:

  • Manufacturing Integration: The Operations Manager is responsible for developing programs, processes and procedures for all aspects of MMR manufacturing including process design, quality assurance, facilities engineering, manufacturing engineering, tool and equipment design, information technology, safety, product development, Lean Six-Sigma, and machinery maintenance. They support Design Engineering in manufacturing process Research and Development, including prototype construction and testing.
  • Must have a broad understanding of all manufacturing processes, with the ability to choose optimized production methods.
  • Must be able to perform break even analyses based on cost, quantity, and other risk factors.
  • Extensive experience in the NQA-1 quality environment, including qualification and commercial grade dedication.
  • Work under both DOE and NRC regulatory oversite a plus.
  • Factory Readiness: As a key member of the Factory Readiness Team, the Operations Manager works closely with Core Division, Construction, Customers, Supply Chain and Logistics to develop and implement integrated corporate systems needed to manage, design, construct, develop the workforce, establish supply chains, commission, and operate the MMR manufacturing facility leveraging standardized and repeatable systems and processes. These systems will ensure that USNC can rapidly deploy manufacturing facilities, manufacture high-quality nuclear components, meet regulatory and quality requirements, meet production goals and do so in a safe, environmentally sound, and financially responsible manner.
  • 20 years o more supply chain management experience is required.
  • Framework Developer: Develops the supply chain structure at the highest levels, including make or buy, sourcing strategies, equipment purchases, and site interfaces and boundaries.
  • Extensive supplier development experience including supplier: identification, support, quality support, and scheduling.
  • Value Engineering: As part of the product and production development phase the manufacturing integration leader works closely with Design Engineering to develop parts, subassemblies and systems that not only meet performance requirements, but are repeatable, interchangeable, and economically producible.
  • Finance: As Manufacturing Integration leader, they work with Finance and the controller to develop and maintain both overhead and project budgets. They develop Basis of Estimates and assist in the proposal process. They are familiar with working in an earned value management system of budgeting and accounting. They implement labor optimization strategies.
  • Staffing: The manufacturing integration manager is also responsible for establishing and developing a management staff for the integration group to include managers of Industrial/Facilities Engineering, QA, Manufacturing Engineering, Information Engineering (IT), Lean Six-Sigma, site specific Integration Managers, Safety and Nuclear Safety.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must possess a BS or BA minimum in Manufacturing Technology, Engineering, Business or a related field. An MBA is preferred.
  • Extensive experience developing and managing Manufacturing Engineering and design of nuclear manufacturing processes for nuclear-grade components and systems. Experience must include implementation of ERP/MRP systems.
  • Experience developing and converting to paperless manufacturing and supply chain processes.
  • Extensive experience managing nuclear facility business systems, manufacturing operations, and associated programs, processes, and procedures including corrective action and root cause analysis programs.
  • Minimum 20 years of Management or Leadership experience in a nuclear environment including experience with Nuclear Safety Culture, Safety Conscious Work Environment, Lean Enterprise Systems, DFA/DFMA, Integrated Safety Management Systems (ISMS), and Design for Six Sigma
  • Strong commitment to employee safety and well-being

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Proven ability to implement Lean manufacturing methodology in new and existing production settings. The aptitude to develop Lean practices both at the cell level and factory wide, in both manufacturing and office process settings.
  • Extensive knowledge of Nuclear Safety Systems, Nuclear Change Evaluation, and working in NRC Nuclear licensed and regulated environments
  • Experience developing and implementing Assurance Programs; both NQA-1 and ISO 9001 quality programs and processes, Contractor Assurance, Conduct of Operations/Readiness, and the Software Management Programs.
  • Knowledge of EVMS (Earned Value Management Systems) including budget development and maintenance, (CAM) control account management, and proforma financial forecasting.
  • Understanding of records management and document control (RMDC) systems.
  • Candidate must be a Qualified Six-Sigma Black Belt
  • Must have working knowledge or be familiar with SharePoint, Microsoft Office Suite
  • Have effective communication skills and understanding of the corporate culture with an ability to influence key stakeholders and decision makers across USNC
  • Exceptional leadership, communication, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills
  • Proficient in computer skills and possess the ability to effectively use various analytical, design, project management, and presentation computer programs
  • Required: Data analysis and Statistical skills. Experience with Minitab or other statistical analysis tools.
  • Have excellent verbal, written communication, and time management skills
  • Advanced technical writing skills: develop policies, procedures, guides, and program description documents.
  • Have a strong orientation toward internal and external customers
  • Work with other departments to increase overall strength of the group and company
  • Must be an excellent negotiator and motivator.
  • Possess excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with others
  • Effectively manage, supervise, motivate, direct, coordinate and provide guidance to the staff of the departments
  • Must be able to not only manage but lead large cross-functional teams of personnel in disbursed locations, and multicultural environments.
  • Possess the ability to influence and motivate stakeholders who are not under your direct operational control.
  • Resolve project and operational issues
  • Analyze and solve problems daily
  • The ability to balance analysis and urgency when making decisions where all of the data may not be readily available.
  • Maintains collaborative, courteous, and respectful relationships
  • Ability to foster a collaborative team environment

TO APPLY:

Please include the following in your application in PDF format:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume

EXPORT CONTROL REQUIREMENTS:

To confirm to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., or a protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).

  • Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?
  • Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for an immigration-related employment benefit (e.g., H-1B, TN, green card, etc.)?

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT:

USNC embraces diversity and equal opportunity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are striving to build the diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that will make our technology a reality. USNC actively encourages applicants from historically underrepresented backgrounds to apply to this and other roles, acknowledging and committing to address the historical lack of diversity within the nuclear and aerospace industries.

USNC does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.

ABOUT ULTRA SAFE NUCLEAR:

Based in Seattle, Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation (USNC) develops nuclear hardware and services for reliable, clean energy anywhere on Earth and in space. USNC offers full-stack capabilities including specialized reactor design services, advanced materials and fuel development, and reactor manufacturing and system deployment.

USNC has offices in USA, Canada, France, Korea, Poland, South Africa, the UK and more.

results.title: Product Manager, Payments
results.description:
About Us


At Pagos, we’re passionate about empowering businesses to take control of their payments stack and solve the puzzles standing between them and optimized growth. Our global platform provides developers, product teams, and payments leaders with both a deeper understanding of their payments data and access to new payments technology through user-friendly tools that are easy to implement. To succeed in this, we need creative thinkers who are willing to roll up their sleeves and start building alongside us.

 

About the Role

In this role, you’ll play a key part in building our payments intelligence products. This role owns the end-to-end design and delivery of new product features and execution against the product roadmap. 

Pagos Product Managers partner closely with Engineering, Data Science, Design, Content Management and various customer-facing teams to support product implementation and perpetuate a customer-centric mindset.

As a Product Manager, you will:

  • Create and execute actionable product plans with a high level of ownership and visibility

  • Manage a sprint cadence and output in conjunction with machine learning engineering team and data scientist product managers

  • Collaborate with Design and Content Management to create intuitive user paths within the product UI and support content for self help

  • Work closely with Sales and Account Management to lead with the customer in mind

 

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone with:

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a product manager and/or consultant within the fintech industry

  • Experience with building or managing predictive or statistics-based products and/or models

  • Comfort navigating, visualizing, and understanding relational data

  • Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal with the ability to influence and align cross functional groups to drive results

  • Proven ability to manage complex timelines and deliver high quality results 

  • A bias for action, where no task is too small 

  • A diligent focus on customer experience and outcomes

 

Nice to haves: 

  • Business intelligence background

  • Experience in the consumer finance industry

  • SQL experience

results.title: Associate Instructional Designer
results.description:
Are you ready for a new way of working? Automox is launching organizations into the future with cloud-native IT operations. By ditching clunky legacy tools and automating soul-crushing manual tasks, IT admins can get back to more exciting, strategic work. Behind our effortlessly modern platform is a group of builders, innovators, and entrepreneurial thinkers breaking the status quo–and having a lot of fun doing it. Our award winning culture, values, and community are shaped by real people doing really extraordinary work. 
 
Ditch your daily commute, say goodbye to the typical nine-to-five, and embrace a new way of working at Automox.
 
OVERVIEW
 
Automox is seeking a passionate Associate Instructional Designer to  join our fast-growing team. This role  works cross-functionally with Product Management, Engineering, and the Customer Experience team to develop training courseware that is extensible, modular and that suits delivery in multiple modalities:  on-demand, VILT, and classroom. Having familiarity  in IT Operations combined with a strong interest in training and course design are essential for this role. 



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
  • Able to create and read a course design document and develop a course that aligns with a learning objective-based curriculum from inception to completion.Working in a variety of formats including print, graphics, audio, video, and animation/simulation technologies to support curriculum offerings.Work with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and others across the organization to create accurate, useful  training modules for classroom and online courses.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE

  • Have experience with IT Management  solutions, tools, and domains
  • Strong technical aptitude and knowledge of web server technology and SaaS
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

results.title: Full Stack Engineer
results.description:
はじめまして  /hajimemashite/  'nice to meet you'

We are a financial technology company that offers mobile daily banking services in Japan. We help customers open a local bank account, manage everyday spending, use overdraft, and transfer money back home.

About your role:

Your mission as a full stack engineer in the product engineering team is to help customers safely onboard our services and to assure they can reliably manage their everyday spending via payments, cards, and cash withdrawals.

Objectives of your role

  • Work across the full stack, building highly scalable distributed solutions that enable positive and secure user experiences and measurable business growth.
  • Develop new features and infrastructure in support of rapidly emerging business and product requirements.
  • Assume initiative to propose and deliver a compelling technical solution from early proof-of-concept to testing against user requirements to market-ready release.
  • Ensure application performance, uptime, and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful application UX/UI design.

Daily and monthly responsibilities

  • Design and build end-to-end systems optimized for security, speed and scale.
  • Participate in all aspects of iterative software development including design, implementation, testing, deployment, publishing, and troubleshooting.
  • Search, learn, and familiarize yourself with current tech trends. Discover and implement new technologies that yield a competitive advantage.
  • Collaborate across multiple ethnic cultures via Slack, Jira comments, Confluence documents, and frequent video conferences.

Team and culture:

  • Born global and born remote
    We are nomads with the world as our home. We demonstrate with kind actions that every employee belongs to our  一門  /ichimon/  'clan'.
  • We are our customers
    It's personal, because we have lived through the pain of the underbanked. We empathize with our customers and adapt to their feedback.
  • Bring choices to the table
    We are proactive in seeking out challenges and opportunities. We are transparent in communication and propose multiple courses of action to deliver a solution.
  • Become a learning machine
    We continuously upskill to achieve freedom of maneuver with our team and to triumph over challenges.

Required skills and qualifications:

  • Experience working with Java, Spring Boot, Flutter & AWS.
  • Bonus points for experience working with Kotlin, AWS, CI/CD, RDS, Postgres.
  • You are motivated by the impact that your work has.
  • You enjoy writing testable code and believe in Test Driven Development.
  • Fluent English is a must.
  • You are a confident communicator. Communicating with teammates, collecting requirements, describing product features, demoing work in progress, and providing updates are integral parts of your work.
  • You have a self-starter mindset: you enjoy working in a fast-paced team where you can take the initiative. You are autonomous and independent, but you also know when to collaborate with the rest of the team.
  • You are a risk-taker: you’re not afraid of challenges, and you think being questioned on your assumptions and decisions helps you grow.
  • Previous experience with building finance/banking products.
  • Bonus points if you speak Japanese.

What we offer:

  • Continuous learning environment.
  • Improve your technical skill-set.
  • Trust and freedom.
  • Supportive and highly skilled team members.
  • Great culture of transparency and openness.
  • Opportunity to make a real impact in customers’ lives.

results.title: Squad Lead
results.description:
Sherpany is the Swiss market leader for meeting management software. Since its founding in 2011 it has pursued the goal of creating a world in which every meeting counts. Over 300 European companies and 12,000 decision-makers are already using Sherpany with the aim of making their business relevant meetings more productive and thereby increasing corporate success. According to a jury of international investors, Sherpany is one of the best scale-ups in Switzerland with the potential to become a unicorn. Sherpany employs over 150 people in six locations in Europe and remotely in 19 countries around the world.


The role:
You are part of our product department, consisting of 60 people and divided into different squads/sub-teams. In this role you partner with the product owner and coach the team with members from Engineering, UX, UI, QA and Data Analysis. You will guide them towards a sustainable continuous pace and support them in their development to maturity. You plan and orchestrate work execution and help our self-organized teams to achieve their goals. With your coaching they are led towards transparency, information exchange and collaboration and engage in continuous improvement efforts. It will also be your task to encourage cross-squad collaboration and communication, build sustainable working relationships with your colleagues and guide them in their personal development.

This job is for you if: 

  • You look forward to supporting our team with your broad know-how and practical experience as a Scrum Master/Squad Leader/Agile Coach or similar.
  • In your former jobs you have worked in software development environments.
  • You love mentoring a team towards its full potential, by using your empathy, interpersonal communication skills and trying out and coaching agile concepts. 
  • You are able to fluently converse and write in English when communicating with your team

How you can imagine us: 

  • You are part of a company with people working from everywhere in the world, in which you can take lot of responsibility and your ideas are always welcome
  • In order to maintain your work-life balance we offer flexible working hours, home office and/or remote-working
  • Your personal and professional development is important to us which is why we offer financial support for further education, training, etc.
  • We work with modern Apple products; every employee receives a MacBook to work with
  • Last but not least: Our corporate culture means a lot to us, which is why we organize regular team events and cultivate a value-centric cooperation

Our recruiting process:

  1. Send your online application 
  2. First interview with our Talent Acquisition Specialist
  3. Interview with Head of Engineering and Chief Product Officer 
  4. Final interview: Get to know the squad  
  5. Offer

results.title: Human Resources Business Partner Lead
results.description:
Company Description
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

Our HR Business Partners (HRBP) support specific teams, working closely with management and employees on people-related issues: talent management, employee relations, coaching/development, compensation, conflict and performance management, organizational development and more. HRBPs are instrumental in initiating and driving HR programs and initiatives within specific functions.

We’re looking for a HRBP Lead to drive people and business initiatives across Square. You are someone who is interested in making a significant impact in our Customer Success organization and excels in a fast-paced, high engagement environment with extraordinary desire to innovate. You will work closely with business leaders to provide hands-on and strategic input, insight, and advice with respect to employee relations, performance management, coaching, compensation, conflict management, organizational development, training and more. You’re comfortable speaking up and driving initiatives forward despite any unexpected roadblocks. You will report to Square's HR Lead.  

You will:

  • Partner with mid-level management and senior executives to develop and implement effective HR policies and practices to support the strategic growth of the business
  • Provide HR expertise in the areas of compensation, feedback, performance management, employee relations, development and coaching, and organizational development
  • Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution
  • Collaborate with the People team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results
  • Develop multi-year people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction
  • Lead core HR processes such as performance calibration, compensation cycle, promotions
  • Analyze and interpret various types of employee reports (eg, compensation, job levels, and attrition) to guide decision-making and provide proactive solutions to client groups
  • Partner with HRBP and Learning & Programs colleagues to work on value-added programs in areas of training, development, career mobility and job performance


Qualifications

You have: 

  • Minimum 8 years experience in HR and prior experience leading teams
  • Relevant experience building and improving company culture and increasing employee engagement, and expertise in performance management

results.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Manager (f/m/d)
results.description:
YOUR MISSION

We are looking for an experienced Senior Talent Acquisition Manager to help our company find and retain excellent employees. You will be entrusted with an ongoing quest to discover talent, build a strong employment brand and ensure great relationships with both candidates and employees. You'll also work on shaping our hiring processes and mentor other members of your team.

You'll be our first full-time member of our Talent Acquisition Team within the Tech department, working closely with Tech Leadership and HR.

To excel as Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, we expect you to be experienced in full-cycle recruiting and employment branding. You should have a sharp eye for talented people and a steady commitment to help them find success in our company. In the past you've managed talents successfully and will do so in a respectful, transparent and educative manner.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Determine current staffing needs and produce forecasts
  • Develop talent acquisition strategies and hiring plans
  • Lead employment branding initiatives
  • Perform sourcing to fill open positions and anticipate future needs
  • Plan and conduct recruitment and selection processes (interviews, screening calls etc.)
  • Take steps to ensure positive candidate experience
  • Assist in employee retention and development
  • Supervise recruiting personnel
  • Organize and/or attend career fairs, assessment centers or other events
  • Use metrics to create reports and identify areas of improvement

Requirements

YOUR PROFILE

Proven experience as talent acquisition manager in a tech company

Some experience in leading a small team

  • Experience in full-cycle recruiting, sourcing and employment branding
  • Understanding of all selection methods and techniques
  • Highly proficient in the use of social media, job boards and recruitment tools
  • Good existing understanding and willingness to understand the duties and competencies of different roles
  • Good knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), ideally workable.com, and talent databases
  • Passion for people, their careers and their well-being
  • Excellent communicator
  • Exceptionally well-organized
  • Team Leadership experience for future expansions of the Talent Team
  • BSc/BA in business administration, human resources or relevant field

Benefits

WHY US?

Factor Eleven's tech department is the inhouse tech scale-up responsible for our SaaS product suite offering localized digital advertising to enterprises of all sizes and shapes. We're powering the engine that Factor Eleven is successfully built upon and elevate the possibilities of our product on a daily basis. In 2022 we've scaled up, literally doubled in headcount and in 2023 we'll double again. We're working together to fulfill our ambitions as a top ad-tech provider by continuously leveling up the quality and expanding capabilities of the entire platform, as well as our engineering and product organization.

Join our amazing team in our mission to move digital localized advertisement forward and enjoy the freedom, camaraderie and perks of our fully remote operations.

OUR PERKS & BENEFITS

  • Transparent, above-market salaries
  • 100% remote within Europe
  • Flexible work-hours and part-time models
  • Be part of a fast-growing, highly-skilled team
  • In person department and company events
  • Home office, co-working space and work-together allowance
  • Personal and professional development courses from Udemy
  • Case by case relocation and visa support

results.title: Healthcare Recruiter
results.description:
Potential to earn $40,000-$120,000 in your first year with average recruiters making $120,000-$200,000 in the second year ($19.23/hour + Commission)!

As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host’s core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• Consistently meets and/or exceeds sales goals by driving new placements and retention of clinicians on assignment.

• Actively prospects, pre-screens and activates candidate leads through cold calling, email and text blasting. Identifies relevant open job opportunities that match the candidate’s specialty experience and professional interests.

• Understands clinician job requirements. Creates compelling candidate profiles for submission to hiring managers. Follows up daily on active candidate submissions and collaborates with account managers to ensure candidates move rapidly through the hiring process.

• Ensures interviews are scheduled and works with account managers to solicit assignment and extension offers on behalf of candidates. Able to pre-close and close offers with candidates to drive offer acceptance.

• Maintains strong rapport with clinicians on assignment to ensure a positive experience and actively drives assignment extensions and rebooking of clinicians at other facilities. Assists in resolving service or credentialing issues that may arise.

• Accurately enters all candidate and placement activity into the Host Healthcare database.


Qualifications:

• High school diploma required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

• Previous sales experience and/or healthcare knowledge preferred.

• Excellent verbal and written communications. Able to negotiate and problem-solve collaboratively with candidates and internal team members.

• Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Able to maintain an organized, well-run sales desk and meet required turnaround times. Comfortable within in a fast-paced work environment.

• High comfort level operating within technology platforms (e.g., Target Recruit)


Benefits and Compensation:

• Uncapped commission!

• Benefits on day 1 (medical, dental, vision) and company-paid life insurance; short and long-term disability; supplemental life insurance for yourself, spouse & child(ren); and multiple voluntary benefits [Hawaii residents receive benefits on the first day of the month following hire date!]

• Eligible for 401K after 6 months of hire - company match at 1 year!

• Remote work option - work from anywhere in the United States

• We provide your equipment (laptop, monitors, headset, etc.)

• Discounted gym memberships

• Flexible PTO

• 10 paid holidays

• Training programs for growth and development

• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

• Pet insurance - don't forget about our furry friends!
